overview: The purpose of this measure is to appropriate moneys to satisfy various claims against the State, its officers, or its employees, including claims for judgments against the State, settlements, and other miscellaneous claims. [10] Since the bill was last amended, eight new claims were resolved that total $1,285,077.67 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt). [9] Including the new claims, the appropriation request totals $7,854,458.74 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt) allocated among thirty-one claims. [9]
appropriations: Testimony indicates the Department of the Attorney General requests that the bill be amended to add two new claims that total $70,514.00 (HB990_HD2_TESTIMONY_JDC_03-13-25_.PDF.txt) and an additional eight new claims that total $1,285,077.67 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt). [8] [9] The updated appropriation request totals $7,854,458.74 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt). [9] This includes an appropriation in the amount of $6,444,458.74 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt) from the general fund and $1,410,000.00 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt) from departmental funds. [9]
assumptions_and_methodology: The measure was amended to correct the description of the claims for Billy Peter v. Anne E. Lopez and Child Evangelism Fellowship of Hawaii, Inc. v. Hawaii State Department of Education to indicate that the claims were resolved by judgment, rather than settlement. [10] Additionally, two new claims totaling $70,514.00 (HB990_HD2_TESTIMONY_JDC_03-13-25_.PDF.txt) were added. [8] A subsequent amendment added eight new claims that total $1,285,077.67 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt), bringing the total number of claims to thirty-one. [9] [9]
revenue_sources: The updated appropriation request includes an appropriation in the amount of $6,444,458.74 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt), allocated among twenty-seven claims to be paid from the general fund. [9] It also includes an appropriation in the amount of $1,410,000.00 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt), allocated to four claims to be paid from departmental funds. [9] The legislative document specifies that sums are also appropriated out of the state highway fund and judiciary funds. [9] [9]
six_year_fiscal_implications: The legislative document specifies funding was added to cover a miscellaneous claim of $514.00 (HB990_SD1_.HTM.txt) for Neal M. Tamashiro. [9] It also adds $70,000.00 (HB990_SD1_.HTM.txt) for the settlement of Lisa Ann Daguro v. State of Hawaii. [9] Testimony requests an additional eight claims be added. [9] These claims include a tort claim against the Department of Health for John Chung v. State of Hawaii for $298,000.00 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt), and another for Kamaka Air, Inc. for $512,700.83 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt). A judgment against the Department of Human Services for Jane Roe v. State of Hawaii for $495,000.00 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt) has been added. Claims against the Department of Transportation for Lori Arakaki v. State of Hawaii for $115,000.00 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt) and the Estate of Reid Okamura v. State of Hawaii for $70,000.00 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt) are included. The University of Hawaii has a claim for the settlement of Robert Ibarra v. Board of Regents of the University of Hawaii for $166,492.00 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt). Two miscellaneous claims for outdated checks for DTRIC Insurance Company, Ltd. for $50,210.67 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt) and Wilson Okamoto Corporation for $22,674.17 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt) were also added. All unexpended and unencumbered balances of the appropriations made in this Act as of the close of business on June 30, 2026, shall lapse. [9]
